snippet: Scientists studying weather and energy consumption have found that activities from urban areas can warm the air by nearly 2 degrees as far as 1,000 miles away.
abstract: Study in journal Nature Climate Change finds that activities from urban areas can warm air as far as1,000 miles away, phenomenon that may help explain why some areas are experiencing more winter warming than climate computer models had projected.
lead_paragraph: Scientists studying weather and energy consumption have found that activities from urban areas can warm the air by nearly 2 degrees as far as 1,000 miles away.

headline.print_headline: Climate: Warming Effect of Urban Activities Felt Widely
headline.seo: Warming Effect of Urban Activities Felt Widely
headline.main: Warming Effect of Urban Activities Felt Widely
